metadata.title: CVE-2023-3141 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in r592_remove indrivers/memstick/host/r592.c in media access in the Linux Kernel. This flawallows a local attacker to crash the system at device disconnect, possiblyleading to a kernel information leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
